doc.previous: Women of the emperor s family were often depicted dressed as goddesses or divine personifications such as Pax Peace Portraiture in painting is represented primarily by the Fayum mummy portraits which evoke Egyptian and Roman traditions of commemorating the dead with the realistic painting techniques of the Empire Marble portrait sculpture would have been painted and while traces of paint have only rarely survived the centuries the Fayum portraits indicate why ancient literary sources marvelled at how lifelike artistic representations could be 417
